summary: This is a service request form from the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated September 24, 2019. It requests phone support for the installation of a new NICE Vision system, specifically for creating users and profiles. The request is marked as a priority and indicates the system is not under warranty.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Listed as assigned to the service request for programming profiles and users in the NICE Vision system at the FBOP MCC New York.

events.title: Service Request for NICE Vision System Installation
events.description: A priority service request is created by the FBOP MCC New York for phone support to assist in creating users and profiles during the installation of a new NICE Vision system.

locations.context: Service location and billing address for the FBOP Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

keyFacts: The document is a service request from the Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated September 24, 2019.
The request is for technical support (creating users and profiles) related to the installation of a new 'NICE Vision' system, which is likely a video surveillance or recording system.
The request is marked as a priority (P3 - Next Day) and confirms the system is not under warranty.
The document provides the specific address of the FBOP MCC New York facility: 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007.
The document is administrative and does not directly mention Jeffrey Epstein, any associates, victims, or criminal activities.
